div.a: Pascack Valley Regional High School District

div.div:
The Pascack Valley Regional High School District is committed to the health and safety of our community, while striving to continue the education of our students in the midst of this health emergency.
Below please find information regarding the state of the emergency and our district response. All information was reviewed and/or updated as of April 16, 2020.

div.script:

                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_0","title":"Official Information","content":"
Updated March 26, 2020

Reviewed April 16, 2020



We are recommending all in our community obtain COVID-19 updates from official local, county, state, federal, and world organizations.  Below is a link to resources pertaining to our region.

    
Center for Disease Control (CDC)
    
World Health Organization
    
NJ COVID-19 Information Hub
    
Bergen County
    
Local Municipalities
    
        
Hillsdale
        
Montvale
        
River Vale
        
Woodcliff Lake
    
    


The Bergen County Department of Education and Department of Health have mandated that school districts NOT make any public statements about the status of staff, students, or parents regarding either presumptive or confirmed cases of COVID-19.  The Department of Health will be managing all communication for these situations.

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_1","title":"State of the District","content":"
Updated: April 16, 2020



As per Governor Murphy's executive order, Pascack Hills High School, Pascack Valley High School, and Park Academy are and will remain closed as long as his order remains in effect.  He announced on April 16, 2020 that schools will be closed until at least Friday, May 15.  We will provide updated information as it becomes available.



Based on this, we have the following plan in place:

    
We will continue with remote learning until at least Friday, May 15.
    
The New Jersey State Department of Education has confirmed that all State Assessments, which includes the NJSLA, DLM, and Access for ELLs, have been cancelled for the 2019-2020 school year.
    
Our facilities are closed for all events, practices, and competitions.  Outdoor facilities are closed to the public.

Currently, we have only essential employees at the schools:

    
Custodial crews performing deep cleanings of the schools so they are ready to open once the executive order is lifted.
    
SLEO III officers are present to maintain security
    
Administrators and Technology Staff are in the buildings by appointment only


To maintain social distancing, replacements for broken laptops are made by appointment only - tech staff is only on-site for appointments.
COVID-19 Plan submitted to Bergen County Department of Education


","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_2","title":"Remote Learning","content":"
Updated April 16, 2020



We will continue to educate our students through remote learning through at least May 15; we will provide updated information as it becomes available.



Important information for students and parents:

    
Remote learning starts at 9am.
    
        
Students can engage with teachers synchronously during their regularly scheduled period.
        
We will continue operating on an "R1" half day schedule.
    
    
    
Teachers will have the option to host “real time” classes.
    
Students must attend “real time” classes if required by their teachers.
    
        
If a student cannot attend because of extenuating circumstances, the student or parent must make an alternate arrangement with the teacher.
        
"Sleeping late" is not a valid excuse for missing “real time” classes.
    
    
    
Students are still required to login to each of their teacher's Canvas courses, each school day, prior to 2pm. 

We have prepared this Google Doc which includes all of the information our goals, materials needed, student expectations, attendance, support, contact information, and frequently asked questions.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_3","title":"Wellness","content":"Updated March 25, 2020

Reviewed April 16, 2020



Pascack Valley Regional High School District remains committed to the mental health of our community.  We would like to provide some resources, considerations, and contact information to our families during this time.



Resources


    
Awning - customized stress management tools for students, therapists, and educators developed by to PV alumni.  Currently free to all PVRHSD students and staff.
    
NAMI (National Alliance on Mental Health) HelpLine Monday-Friday, 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., EST (800) 950-6264 
    
Fact Sheet: Parent/Caregiver Guide to Helping Families Cope (from NCTSN)
    
Resources from the CDC – COVID19
    
Keeping Your Distance to Stay Safe (from APA)
    
If you need assistance finding food, paying housing bills, accessing free childcare, or other essential services:
    
        
https://www.nj211.org/
        
http://www.211.org/services/covid19
    
    
    
Crisis text line: Feeling anxious?
    
        
https://www.crisistextline.org/blog/covid19-update
    
    



Considerations




    
It is important to monitor ongoing guidelines as designated by the CDC, state, and local agencies which include the new federal guidelines emphasizing a community approach to slow the rate of infection with COVID-19 through social distancing.  These guidelines are available  here.  That said, do not become glued to the news.  Rely on evidenced based reliable sources.  Consider these tips from the American Psychological Association on how to view the news.

    

    
    
In order to keep yourself healthy, prioritize sleep, good hygiene, nutrition, and monitor stress. Remember stress and fear are two of the primary immune disruptors. Social connectedness is an important factor for both physical and mental health.  While we may be disconnected from others physically for the time being, make it a regular routine to facetime, skype or have a phone conversation with family and friends.  Social support networks are key in managing stress.

    

    
    
Develop healthy strategies to cope with stressors including developing a daily routine.  Developing a routine will increase a feeling of agency, control, and predictability.  Engage in family activities, games, crafts, or gardening. Avoid coping with stress by drinking or using drugs which will ultimately weaken your immune system.

    

    
    
Teenagers may not fully understand the rationale for social distancing. We encourage honest conversations with teenagers. They are developmentally capable of understanding the situation, but they need guidance, structure, and reassurance.

    

    
    
If you or your child have an underlying mental health condition, communicate with your mental health treatment team (psychiatrist, psychologist, social worker) to determine whether Telehealth is a better option in the coming weeks. Many practitioners offer this service for clients.  Follow your doctor's guidelines for prescription refill and scheduling appointments.

    

    
    
Consider the following digital or telehealth resource
    
        
Therapists who conduct Telehealth/phone sessions
        
Partnership for Drug Free Kids Drugfree.org

        

        
    
    
    
Speak with a member of the PVRHSD Wellness Staff.  We are able to answer email questions or concerns, as well, as have web conferences via google hangouts or other channels.  Our contact information is listed below.
    

    

    Pascack Valley High School

    Steven Myers, Ph.D., Psychologist - smyers@pascack.org

    Christie Rossig, SAC - crossig@pascack.org

    

    Pascack Hills High School

    Gale Mangold, Ed.S., SAC - gmangold@pascack.org

    Erica Franceski, Ed.M, LPC - efranceski@pascack.org
","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl15_divTabs_4","title":"Technology","content":"
Updated April 16, 2020





The Technology Department is providing support remotely while schools are closed and education continues virtually.  Here is what you need to know:





Contacting Technical Support

    
Students and staff MUST make requests by emailing: phsupport@pascack.org (Hills) or pvsupport@pascack.org (Valley)
    
        
This emails the entire technology staff
        
A technology specialist will initially respond through email and will note how they will communicate further (email, Google Hangout, phone) as appropriate
    
    
    
Parents should email Ms. Maria Valentino with questions or concerns.

     


Physical Repairs

    
We ask everyone to be extra careful with the district issued laptops during this time to minimize the need for repairs.
    
If a repair is necessary, technology staff will schedule a time to meet at the school to swap for a loaner.
    
We must have parental consent for a student to come in for a repair.





Remote Control of Machines

    
Software is now installed on all MacBook Airs allowing technicians to remotely control machines.
    
Technology staff can only access your machine if you enable the software AND give us permission through the software.
    
If remote control is necessary, the technician will send directions for you to enable the software and give us permission.


 ","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,

            }
        }
